lead_paragraph: A state election official has accused the mayor and his allies of “willful and flagrant” campaign finance violations, but the illegality she suggests doesn’t necessarily exist.

headline.print_headline: Faulting de Blasio for Taking a Beaten Path in Elections
headline.main: Faulting de Blasio for Walking a Beaten Path in Elections

snippet: A state election official has accused the mayor and his allies of “willful and flagrant” campaign finance violations, but the illegality she suggests doesn’t necessarily exist.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column raises questions about claim by Risa S Sugarman, chief enforcement counsel for New York State Board of Elections, that New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and his allies flagrantly violated campaign finance laws; notes Sugarman, who was appointed by Gov Andrew Cuomo, has pointed to practice that has been used widely by both Republicans and Democrats alike.
